Class: exports

exports()

This takes the node.js 'events' package and adds the following functionality: - Registration/unregistration of events. Events cannot be emitted until registered. - Pausing / Resuming event emission. Paused events will be added to a queue, and can be optionally emitted at resumption of events. - Relaying of events from one object to another. A relayed event will appear to be emitted from the relaying object, not from the origin object.

new exports()

Members

addListeners

Adds the same listener to multiple events. Usage: - const events = ['foo', 'bar']; - const handler = () => {}; - emitter.addListeners(events, handler);

pauseEvents

Pauses all events. Chainable. Any events emitted while paused will be added to a queue.
Source:
  • EventEmitter.js, line 101

registerEvent

Registers a single event type to be used by this Class. Events must be registered before they can be emitted.

registerEvents

Registers multiple event types to be used by this Class. Events must be registered before they can be emitted.

relayEventsFrom

Relays events from one object to another. A relayed event will appear to be emitted from the relaying object (this), not from the origin object.
